import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import "./home.css"; import { FLASK_URL } from "../Common"; export default function Home() { const Username = "user"; const handleSubmit = async (e) => { e.preventDefault(); try { const response = await fetch(FLASK_URL + "/home", { method: "POST", headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json", }, body: JSON.stringify(Username), }); } catch (error) { console.error("Error:", error); } }; const [cardsData, setCardsData] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { // Fetch data from Flask backend const fetchData = async () => { try { const response = await fetch("http://your-flask-api-endpoint"); const data = await response.json(); setCardsData(data); // Assuming data is an array of card objects } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching data:", error); } }; fetchData(); }, []); // Empty dependency array ensures the effect runs only once on component mount return ( <>
